folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir [pump house]., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park; Belvedere, a pump house at the southwestern corner of the old reservoir.

1890.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir [pump house].

folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Central Park: Lower Reservoir, western side, view northwest. This old reservoir, built around 1840 when the Croton water system was first constructed, and some time before Central Park was conceived of, went out of use a year or two prior to this date. The work of filling it, and demolishing the retaining walls, has now begun.

January 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view, more to the north; the southwestern corner of the reservoir is shown at the extreme left of the picture.

January 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A similar view as No. 2, showing the Reservoir in use. Buildings appearing on the left, line the western boundary of the Park; Central Park West. Note the original appearance of the San Remo, which appears in the latter views with twin towers.

1927.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.

title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.

folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Central Park: Lower Reservoir, western side, view north, showing the old gate houses and the progress made in filling in the
disused reservoir.
June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, four years later. Notice that the old stone house on the northern side of the reservoir site has been demolished.
June 24, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.

folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Central Park: Lower Reservoir, northwestern corner, view northeast, showing the old house on the northern side and the progress already made in filling in the former reservoir. June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a closer view.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.

folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Central Park: Lower Reservoir, eastern part, view northeast, showing the progress already made in filling up the old reservoir.

March 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same scene, four years later. It is hoped to make a garden on this site.

June 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.

folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: Lower Reservoir, eastern part, view north of east, showing progress of the work of filling the old reservoir and levelling the eastern retaining wall.
At the extreme right is the Metropolitan Museum of Art, with the Obelisk, sometimes called "Cleopatra's Needle", in front of it.
June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.

folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Central Park; Lower Reservoir, view north from the southern part, showing the work of filling in at an early stage.
March 30, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a slightly later stage. In both these views the Upper Reservoir can be glimpsed through the row of trees along the 86th Street cross-road (Transverse Road No. 2).
June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.

folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Central Park, Lower Reservoir (site): A view southeast across the southern side, towards the Carlyle apartment building at Madison Avenue and 76th Street. The water has been entirely drained out.
June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, four years later.
June 24, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.

folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park; old stone house, used as a park building, on the northern side of the former Lower Reservoir.
Before 1935 this building will have been demolished.
March 30, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - Reservoirs - Lower reservoir.

folder: Central Park & Reservoirs & Lower reservoir., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: Lower Reservoir, southwestern corner and Belvedere, view south.

June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, a closer view.

June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)

The same, a close-up of the rocks and the old "Belvedere" castle.

June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a view northeast along the embankment of the empty reservoir.
June 28, 1931.
